ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We delved deeply into the differences between the different types of revenge, honor codes, what is a revenge tragedy, etc- I had none of this foundational knowledge before taking the course

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It brings together a vast selection of texts and films from multiple cultures and time periods. A great chance to read a lot or interesting pieces and the discussion is very compelling

Honestly, I would have rather taken this course as a lecture taught by Toni - I was always so interested in what she had to say, and never felt like there was enough time for her to talk in the seminar set up.
This course is very strong in that it actively facillitates thoughtfully discussion of the plays and how they relate to the course overall.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: DefinitelyToni is an amazing professor and the material and issues covered in this course are texts and issues that it's wonderful to think about and talk through in a seminar setting.

Yes I would. I really enjoyed reading the scripts we did, and I don't think I would have read them had I not been assigned them in class. The discussions and analysis in class we're also incredibly interesting and compelling.
